question: You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Make sure the generated code is executable for demonstration purposes. Please create a small game for English vocabulary memorization, in the form of a web page HTML version.

checklist.title: Is the vocabulary memorization system fully implemented?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code implements the core vocabulary learning system with card review, spaced repetition, and word tracking. Score 0 if the core system is missing, 5 if basic flashcard functionality is implemented but lacks systematic review, and 10 if a complete spaced repetition system (like Leitner or SuperMemo algorithm) is implemented with progress tracking.

checklist.title: Is the vocabulary data management effectively designed?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes proper vocabulary data structures, local storage persistence, and vocabulary categorization (by difficulty level, topic, or learning progress). Deduct 5 points if there's no persistent storage implementation, 3 points if vocabulary categorization is missing, and 2 points if the data structure is inefficient for retrieval. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Are learning effectiveness features implemented?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the system includes effectiveness-enhancing features such as: recall testing, wrong answer tracking, review scheduling, and performance statistics. Give 3 points for each well-implemented feature with a maximum of 10 points. Deduct 5 points if the system only shows words without any recall testing.

checklist.title: Is gamification properly integrated into the learning experience?
checklist.description: Assess whether the code implements game mechanics that enhance vocabulary learning: scoring system, achievements/badges, progress indicators, and learning streaks. Each well-implemented gamification element that enhances motivation counts for 2.5 points. Deduct 5 points if gamification elements are superficial and don't reinforce learning behaviors.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as empty vocabulary lists, browser storage limitations, user input errors, etc.) and provide friendly error prompts or recovery mechanisms. Code with strong robustness should be able to effectively handle these edge cases, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no exceptions are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the learning experience (e.g., 1. Audio pronunciation of words 2. Visual mnemonics for difficult words 3. Contextual example sentences 4. Etymological information). Add 2.5 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant implementation of similar functions (e.g., multiple word checking algorithms) 2. Function modules unrelated to vocabulary learning (e.g., a built-in general calculator) 3. Fancy effects that affect performance (e.g., excessive animations). Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core learning functions are interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating learning logic/view/data layers), function encapsulation, and code maintainability. Deduct 5 points if global state pollution is found or design patterns are not used; deduct 5 points if the code duplication rate is too high (over 30%); deduct 5 points if there's no clear separation between presentation and business logic. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows modern design principles: 1) Harmonious color matching (no more than 3 primary colors) 2) Proper layout spacing (element spacing follows the 8px multiple principle) 3) Professional font system (body font size ≥ 14px, line height over 1.5 times). Deduct 3 points for each crowded visual element, 5 points for a glaring color combination, and 5 points for chaotic text-image layout. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the dynamic interaction smooth and seamless?
checklist.description: Judge whether the dynamic effects conform to human perception characteristics: 1) Click feedback delay ≤ 100ms 2) Transition animation duration controlled between 300-500ms 3) Clear visual focus guidance. Deduct 5 points for each operation without feedback, 3 points for visual after-images during fast transitions, and 5 points for hard-to-find key function buttons. The full score is 10 points.
